arma

Enum Op

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Op>
      • arma.Op
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Op>

    public enum Op
extends java.lang.Enum<Op>
    Provides predefined constants to identify arithmetic or relational operators.

    Unary arithmetic operators:
    INCREMENT and DECREMENT

    Binary arithmetic operators:
    PLUS, MINUS, TIMES, ELEMTIMES and ELEMDIVIDE

    Relational operators:
    EQUAL, NOT_EQUAL, STRICT_LESS, LESS, STRICT_GREATER and GREATER

    Author:
    Sebastian Niemann

      DECREMENT
      Decrement (unary arithmetic operator)
      ELEMDIVIDE
      Element-wise division (binary arithmetic operator)
      ELEMTIMES
      Element-wise multiplication (binary arithmetic operator)
      EQUAL
      Equality (relational operator)
      GREATER
      Non-strict greater than (relational operator)
      INCREMENT
      Increment (unary arithmetic operator)
      LESS
      Non-strict less than (relational operator)
      MINUS
      Subtraction (binary arithmetic operator)
      NOT_EQUAL
      Inequality (relational operator)
      PLUS
      Summation (binary arithmetic operator)
      STRICT_GREATER
      Strict greater than (relational operator)
      STRICT_LESS
      Strict less than (relational operator)
      TIMES
      Multiplication (binary arithmetic operator)

      • values

        public static Op[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (Op c : Op.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the enum constant to be returned.
        Returns:
        the enum constant with the specified name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if this enum type has no constant with the specified name
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument is null

      • evaluate

        public static Mat evaluate(Mat a,
           Op operator,
           Mat b)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                           java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Non-canonical: Creates a column vector containing a 1 for each element for which the evaluation of a operator b holds true and 0 otherwise.
        Parameters:
        a - The left-hand side operand
        operator - The operator
        b - The right-hand side operand
        Returns:
        The vector
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - NaN is not a valid operand value.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Both provided matrices must have the same number of elements, but had a.n_elem and b.n_elem elements.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Only relational operators are supported.

      • getResult

        static double getResult(double a,
               Op operator,
               double b)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                        java.lang.ArithmeticException,
                        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Non-canonical: Evaluates an binary arithmetic operation a operator b or returns b if operation = EQUAL.
        Parameters:
        a - The left-hand side operand
        operator - The operator
        b - The right-hand side operand
        Returns:
        The result
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - NaN is not a valid operand.
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - Division by zero.
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - Division by infinity.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Only binary arithmetic operators and equality are supported.

      • underflowOverflowDetection

        static void underflowOverflowDetection(double a,
                              Op operator,
                              double result)
                                throws java.lang.ArithmeticException
        Detects if the result of an unary operation was affected by an overflow.

        Note: The supported unary operators cannot result in an underflow.

        Parameters:
        a - The left-hand side operand
        operator - The operator
        result - The calculated result
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - Overflow detected. a operator resulted in result.

      • underflowOverflowDetection

        static void underflowOverflowDetection(double a,
                              Op operator,
                              double b,
                              double result)
                                throws java.lang.ArithmeticException
        Detects if the result of an binary operation was affected by an underflow or overflow.

        The overflow detection is only active if the operator is one of TIMES, ELEMTIMES or ELEMDIVIDE.

        Parameters:
        a - The left-hand side operand
        operator - The operator
        b - The right-hand side operand
        result - The calculated result
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - Underflow detected. a operator b resulted in result.
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - Overflow detected. a operator b resulted in result.
